name: Herzen House Hotel St. Petersburg

reviews.text: As most reviewers have said, this hotel is centrally located and less expensive than most others in the area. You can easily walk to most tourist attractions, and the staff all speak English and are both welcoming and helpful. The rooms are what I'd call "basic," but they're clean, and ours, which faced away from the street, was extremely quiet. The breakfasts offer a reasonable variety, and on Wednesday afternoons, they have a tea for guests. The place is open 24/7 with coffee, tea, and cookies. It is on the 4th floor of a nondescript building with different hotels on the lower floors as well. Nearby are plenty of restaurants, our favorite being an Italian one, Probeka, which is attached to the building that the hotel is in. Turn left when you leave the hotel; then left again.
reviews.title: Adequate and Affordable Alternative

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This so-called mini hotel in the very centre of St. Petersburg is perfect for exploring the nearby top sites of the beautiful city. I come to St. Petersburg regularly, and this time I wished to stay close to the main sights. The hotel is situated in Bolshaya Morskaya, a few steps from the Isaac cathedral, The Winter Palace and the Admiralty. The hotel is clean and functional, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the address is very convenient if you don't want to spend a fortune to stay in the top class hotels in the neighborhood.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with perfect location

reviews.text: The location of Herzen House could not be bettered, half way between St Isaacs cathedral and Nevsky Prospect, and closer to Palace Square than all of the upscale hotels close to the cathedral (Astoria, Angleterre, Petro Palace and the coming Four Seasons). But it isn't competing with upscale hotels at all. The premises occupy two floors of an old apartments building with centrla stairwell/lift separating the rooms into three "sectors" on each floor. Breakfast is served in a small cafe-style room which is open all day for free self-service tea/coffee/biscuits which is a very useful facility - it's "on tap", with a quiet place to sit, whenever you want it.
reviews.title: Hidden treasure!

reviews.text: Rooms are clean, well furnished (though the double bed is cramped) and with perfectly adequate bathroom (shower, no bathtub). Road noise was not a problem on the fourth floor - hardly noticed any noise at all - and there was no noise at all from the nearby breakfast room. Toiletries provided and telephones in all rooms were unexpected bonuses at this price level.
reviews.title: Excellent location and value

reviews.text: Breakfast was the usual cold cuts, plus fruit, salad, scrambled and hard-boiled egg, kasha, bread, jam, juice, tea, coffee (maybe even chocolate!). As other reviews have noted, it can run out, although I did note that the cold cuts, at least, were replenished.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff , beautiful city and on my list for a return visit

reviews.text: I very much agree with the other reviewers that this hotel is a very good value for the money. It was clean, the breakfast was decent (and included), it is an excellent location, the staff were very kind and helpful, and the management obviously work hard to attain a high standard of quality in this price range.
reviews.title: WiFi internet in room was very flaky

reviews.text: For those travellers who are interested, I did want to report that the wifi internet in the rooms is not sufficient to do any work that requires a sufficient and reliable connection, such as skype, instant messaging, or watching video. There were continual dropped connections and the bandwidth seemed to be very dependent on what others were doing on the internet. The hotel does provide a computer that uses a more reliable internet connection and is therefore able to do skype. However, that is in the lobby of the hotel and therefore a private skype conversation is not possible. If you are only interested in checking email, or don't mind using the computer in the lobby then you don't need to worry about this.
reviews.title: unbeatable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since free wifi is very attractive to some guests (increasing more and more as people carry wireless devices) and this hotel advertises this, I hope the management will pay attention to this issue. Please have a computer expert look at the issue as this appears to be more of a problem than simply a signal strength issue (you may need to look into bandwidth issues). I would also put into place a plan to monitor the system for problems so that they can be fixed right away when they occur. Wifi internet is becoming more important to more people and some business travellers want to save money but still require dependable internet.
reviews.title: Herzen House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I see that one other person mentioned this in a tripadvisor review earlier this year. I did not see that review before I booked, and so I felt I need to highlight this for
reviews.title: Great Mini Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to your staff for making my stay in Peter such a friendly and comfortable one.
reviews.title: great location, very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, easy walking distance to Hermitage and all main attractions. Staff helpful and knowledgeable. Rooms small and could do with a fridge. A/C did not go below 18 degrees which was just about OK as the outside temperature was in the 30's. Self-service breakfast only but free all day tea and coffee. Free internet access.
reviews.title: Small is good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great spot to stay. Well priced in a very expensive city, and really handy to everything. The staff spoke good English and were very helpful. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed the night of June 12th at the Herzen House. The room was very comfortable and the staff was extremely courteous and all spoke English very well.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in St. Petersburg

reviews.text: I booked online through their reservation system. They require one night's deposit and request a copy of your credit card and passport. After a little back and forth, I was able to get them the necessary info. They were very accommodating through the process of booking from the US.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the value

reviews.text: The hotel location is convenient to Nevsky Prospekt and all main attractions. Breakfast and wireless internet are included, although the internet signal was very spotty.
reviews.title: Excellent Value For Money!

reviews.text: We stayed there for 4 days. The location was excellent, very close to Hermitage and St IsaacCathedral. Not far from Mariinskii Theatre and Yusupov Palace. Everything was great. We stayed in a standard room. It wasn’t spacious but very comfortable and cozy. The place was central but extremely quiet. The room was clean and the stuff was friendly and polite. We were warmly welcomed on the reception and in a room we found two chocolate bars. It was a very pleasant surprise. The breakfasts were very tasty and fresh. And if you stay there on Wednesday, you are welcome to Russian Tea with Samovar, sweets, pancakes and what’s more… It was really great!!!! As we stayed there more than 3 nights we were given two tickets to Oceanarium. Nice surprise. We had really nice time in a hotel and would be glad to stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: This hotel was a bit of an unknown to us, and we really selcted it due to its central location and nearness to the Hermitage. We were very pleasantly surprised by the very helpful attitude of the staff - thery went out of their way to be helpful from our arrival to our departure four days later. There is no real restaurant in the hotel, but a good complimentary breakfast is served and tea and coffee are available at any time of day. There are many good restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Excellent location with very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are not large, but modern and clean. There is good wireless internet access throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location & value!

reviews.text: A good example of the staff's commitment to service came at the end of our stay. The hotel phoned our taxi on the way to the airport (they knew the number because they had booked it) to say that I had left a pair of reading spectacles in my room in the hotel. They offered to put the specatacles in another taxi and phoned me several times to confirm the number of the taxi, name of the driver and so on. Sure enough the second taxi driver arrived at the airport with the spectacles! They did not need to do any of that and I was impressed with their attitude and service ethic. I cannot think of many hotels worldwide that I have stayed out that would taken that much trouble. Bravo!!
reviews.title: Cozy and comfortable hotel in the center of the city

reviews.text: Stayed here last August. The location is terrific, right in the middle of the city. The staff were very helpful and polite. They hotel also provided visa invitations in a timely manner. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value budget hotel

reviews.text: I stayed in Herzen House in St. Petersburg for 3 days in July with my daugther and a friend, and I would highly recommend it to anyone. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, staff was very nice and responsive, cozy breakfeast room with good food, plus tea and coffee 24 hours, and internet access at reception area. Hotel is small and family friendly, makes you feel at home. It's in an old building, but everything was recently renovated.
reviews.title: Wonderful mini-hotel Herzen House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location of the hotel is great - short walk to Hermitage and many other museums and historical places.
reviews.title: Loved the Herzen House hotel

likes.liked: — Its location, clean and comfortable rooms, friendly and helpful staff.

reviews.text: Great service provided at this hotel. Nice rooms, shower/tub and excellent breakfast with much variety. The best thing is that it is right in the heart of the city, about a 5 minute walk to Nevsky Prospect and not even 10 minutes to the Hermitage. They recommended me a local Greek restaurant near the hotel my first night and I was not dissapointed .
reviews.title: Heart of City

likes.liked: — Nice staff, nice rooms, close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Herzen House bills itself as is a mini-hotel, meaning that it provides all the essential services (including breakfast, internet access, laundry, and luggage storage), but lacks frills such as a fancy lobby, exercise room, or bar. It occupies one floor of a larger building, with a different hotel on the two floors below. It is located just a couple of blocks from major sights like St. Isaac's and the Hermitage -- and costs much, much less than the standard hotels in the neighborhood. It is, quite simply, an incredible value.
reviews.title: Amazing value and great location

reviews.text: Our room (a superior double) was pleasant and quite spacious, with lots of closet space, large windows, modern decor, and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was also relatively large by European standards, with attractive tile work. The staff at the front desk spoke good English (not necessarily a given in Russia) and proved to be extremely helpful when we ran into difficulties with the company that had sold us ballet tickets. Breakfast was the weakest part of the experience: the breakfast room is somewhat spartan, and the food was adequate but uninspired (it was a scaled back version of the usual cereal, yogurt, bread, meat, cheese, and eggs). On the other hand, coffee, tea, and cookies were available, for free, all day and evening -- an amenity that we took advantage of quite a few times after returning tired and footsore from sightseeing.
reviews.title: Spotless and Good Value for St Petersburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unless you need a five-star experience, or simply want to pour money down the drain, I can heartily recommend the Herzen House. During our six-night stay, it really did become a home away from home.
reviews.title: An Excellent Centrally Located Mini Hotel in St Petersburg

reviews.text: Given the limited alternatives for Hotels in St. Petersburg, the Herzen is a very good choice. The staff was great and very responsive to any requests. The rooms were spotless, quiet and comfortable, but very small. The breakfast which is included in the room rate was good. It is also in a very good location and only a short walk from the Hermitage. There are several restaurants and a small convenience store close by. We stayed there for 7 nights and would certainly go back. They are a small property and fill up quickly, so you must book several months in advance if you will be in St. Petersburg during the tourist season. They have a good web site and are prompt in responding to any emails.
reviews.title: Polite and always willing to help

description: Ideally located in the very heart of Saint-Petersburg, within 5-minute walk from city's major attractions, such as the The Palace Square, St. Isaac's Cathedral, The Admirality, The State Hermitage Museum. The Hotel provides cosy interiors, convenient position and friendly English-speaking staff who would be delighted to welcome tourists and business travelers to the city of St. Petersburg. All rooms are designed in calm pastel colors, have comfortable furniture, satellite TV, telephone, air-conditioner, shower, hairdryer, complimentary Internet access.Voltage:220V.
